text:
Union Minister Ram Vilas Paswan on Saturday said Dalit icon Babasaheb Ambedkar should be awarded the Nobel Peace Prize.

“Babasaheb Ambedkar deserves the Nobel Prize. He should be honoured the way Dr. Martin Luther King and Nelson Mandela were,” Mr. Paswan told PTI here, adding: “From today, it will be my mission to ensure that Ambedkar gets the Nobel Prize for the tremendous work he did to uplift the poor and downtrodden.”

Mr. Paswan, founder and chief of the Lok Janshakti Party, said his party workers would undertake a campaign to ensure maximum public awareness and participation. Dr. Martin Luther King and Nelson Mandela were conferred with the peace prize in 1964 and 1993 respectively for fighting racial discrimination.

The Union Minister, who was here to attend the Dalit Indian Chamber of Commerce and Industry conference, said corporate houses should encourage Dalit entrepreneurs. “Encouraging one Dalit entrepreneur means helping create 10 jobs for Dalits.”

He said the government would support DICCI chief Milind Kamble’s mission of creating lakhs of Dalit entrepreneurs. —PTI
title: Babasaheb Ambedkar should get Nobel Peace Prize, says Paswan
